Title: gv: Exploitable Buffer Overflow
Synopsis:
gv contains an exploitable buffer overflow that allows an attacker to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: gv is a PostScript and PDF viewer for X which provides a user interface for the ghostscript interpreter.

Description.Text: gv contains a buffer overflow vulnerability where an unsafe sscanf() call is used to interpret PDF and PostScript files.

Impact.Text: By enticing a user to view a malformed PDF or PostScript file an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running gv.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of gv.

P.Text: All gv users should upgrade to the latest version:
